meanings.sent1: Her recessiveness made her blend into the background during the school play.
meanings.sent2: The recessiveness of the color made it perfect for the calming bedroom walls.
meanings.sent3: Despite her recessiveness, she always shone brightly in her own quiet way.
meanings.sent4: The recessiveness of the melody allowed the lyrics to take center stage.
meanings.sent5: The recessiveness of the scent lingered in the room long after the flowers were gone.

meanings.sent1: The recessiveness of the clouds signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: His recessiveness in social situations often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The cat's recessiveness was mistaken for aloofness by the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The recessiveness of the old building hinted at its former grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The recessiveness of the painting's colors created a sense of mystery.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a gene to be masked by its dominant allele.
meanings.sent1: The recessiveness of the gene explained the unexpected trait in the offspring.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the recessiveness of the genetic trait in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The recessiveness of the gene was revealed through careful genetic analysis.
meanings.sent4: The recessiveness of the allele became apparent in the second generation.
meanings.sent5: The recessiveness of the gene played a crucial role in the inheritance pattern.
